title: Ticket #4281: Change default settings so that jobs are not preempted by default
description: One of the most common questions for new HTCondor admins is how to turn off job preemption. This ticket proposes to change the default out-of-the-box configuration for HTCondor so that jobs are not preempted by default, and thus enabling job preemption as before is opt-in.
remarks:
2014-Mar-27 15:32:48 by tannenba:
NOTE: This code must undergo a code review before v8.1.6

2014-May-22 14:48:17 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Looking over this patch, it looks like it essentially comments out and/or removes a bunch of settings from the condor_config file and places the below defaults into the param table: 

  PREEMPTION_REQUIREMENTS = False
  START = True
  PREEMPTION_RANK =
  NEGOTIATOR_PRE_JOB_RANK = RemoteOwner=?=UNDEFINED
  NEGOTIATOR_POST_JOB_RANK = (RemoteOwner=?=UNDEFINED) *
           (ifthenElse(isUndefined(KFlops),1000,Kflops) - \
           SlotID - 1.0e10*(Offline=?=True))
  WANT_SUSPEND=FALSE
  WANT_VACATE=FALSE
  SUSPEND=FALSE
  CONTINUE=TRUE
  PREEMPT=FALSE
  KILL=FALSE
  PERIODIC_CHECKPOINT = ((time()-LastPeriodicCheckpoint)/60.0)> \
            (180.0+$RANDOM_INTEGER(-30,30,1))
  CLAIM_WORKLIFE = 3600

Looking this over, I think we can do better before v8.2.0. Some items noticed:

  1. CLAIM_WORKLIFE of an hour seems a bit long esp with preemption disabled by default; seems like 20 minutes seems better in absence of preemption.
  2. Wouldn't it be better to disable preemption via MaxJobRetirementTime instead of changing PREEMPTION_REQUIREMENTS ? This way, the no preemption policy is honored even in the face of draining, for instance. Also it would be easier for an admin to re-enable preemption by simply adjusting the MaxJobRetirementTime to whatever they want instead of messing around with a potentially complicated expression.
  3. condor_config.annotated should be released, i.e. the CMakefile should be modified to copy it into the release examples directory. Right now it looks like the only place condor_config.annotated can be found is in the source code.
  4. should metaknob policy always_run be enabled by default, just like the host security metaknob is? BTW, if this metaknob, MaxJobRetirementTime is 0 - what does that mean?
  5. should preemption_rank go by inverse wall clock time by default?
  6. the "uwcs" preemption_requirements expression looks to be broken. guessing it evaluates to undefined most of the time due to bug #4369
  7. we should have negotiator_pre_job_rank do some local best fit with respect to cpu and memory.

Going to resolve this ticket and open a new ticket for v8.2.0 to address the above items.
